perturbation.original_text:
“Bandwidth” means the measurement of samples of usage taken every five (5) minutes during a calendar month and collecting two (2)
readings (cumulative of inbound feeds and cumulative of outbound feeds at the same measured point in time). The measurements are
stored and become data points. At the end of the month, all data points taken during the month are ranked in ascending order. IBM will
discard the top five percent (5%) for each set (inbound and outbound) of data points. The highest remaining sample of the two (2) sets
becomes the Customer’s Committed or Burstable usage number for that billing cycle.
perturbation.changed_text: “Bandwidth” means an estimate of the expected data transfer rate during a calendar month, based on historical averages. The measurements are estimates and do not reflect precise usage. IBM will calculate and not disclose any readings to the customer. At the end of the month, IBM determines Customer’s Committed or Burstable usage number for that billing cycle.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of bandwidth is changed from a measured value to an estimated amount. This contradicts standard industry and statutory meanings where bandwidth is usually a quantifiable metric of data transfer, leading to potential disputes over billing since precise usage isn't tracked.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Truth in Advertising laws, potentially impacting billing practices.

perturbation.original_text: “Local Storage” has the same definition as Direct Access Storage
perturbation.changed_text: “Local Storage” has the same definition as Cloud Based Storage
perturbation.explanation: The definition of Local Storage is changed to have the same definition as cloud based storage. These definitions contradict each other since Local Storage has traditionally referred to having the storage on premise whereas Cloud Based Storage refers to having the storage off premise.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Truth in Advertising laws, potentially impacting service definitions.

perturbation.original_text:
“Materials” means literary or other works of authorship (such as programs, program listings, programming tools, documentation,
reports, drawings and similar works) that IBM may deliver to Customer as part of Services.  “Materials” does not include licensed
program products available under their own license agreements or Base Components.
perturbation.changed_text:
“Materials” means literary or other works of authorship (such as programs, program listings, programming tools, documentation,
reports, drawings and similar works) that IBM may deliver to Customer as part of Services.  “Materials” includes anything that is provided such as licensed
program products available under their own license agreements or Base Components.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of Materials is changed to including anything, which is a contradiction to its previous definition. This change causes uncertainty, as the wording is different between the original and modified text. This affects Intellectual property law.
